Package com.mygdx.game

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Boulder
    The Boulder class is responsible for the rendering and movement of boulders.
    Difficulty
    The Difficulty class is used to allow the user to select the difficulty of the game.
    GameScreen
    The GameScreen class is used to display the main character sprite's movement, as well as render the maps and collision for the game.
    HighScore
    This class, using Java's FileIO, reads the user's score in game, sorts the score using a selection sort algorithm, and then writes the user's score on a save file.
    Instructions
    This class is responsible for displaying the instructions screen, which contains information regarding how to play the game, and what the game is about.
    LoadSave
    This class is responsible for reading information from a save file that the user is saving their game to (which includes information such as the current level the user is on, their name, and their current time.
    MainGame
    The MainGame, which extends the Game class, is responsible for starting the program by setting the game screen to the SplashScreen class.
    MainMenu
    The MainMenu class displays the main menu screen for the user that controls general program flow.
    NameInput
    The NameInput, which implements the Screen interface, is responsible for displaying a screen that allows the user to enter a String as their username.
    Save
    The Save class acts as a data class that temporarily stores the user's data, such as their username, the difficulty and level they are currently on, as well as the time they currently have (in seconds).
    SaveManager
    The SaveManager class is responsible for saving the user's data into separate save files.
    SplashScreen
    The SplashScreen class shows an animation of the main character running across the screen with a boulder following, displaying the company name on the screen.
